intro: Amsinckia orcuttii, commonly known as the Or-cutt's fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, dandelion-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces a cluster of small, yellow blooms at the top of its stem. Amsinckia orcuttii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
